intro: Cynometra rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered ironwood, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and striking red flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain a single seed. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
